node.title: Biden Jokes Only Santa Can Keep Promise of Gifts Arriving on Time Amid Supply Chain Woes
node.alt: President Joe Biden on Wednesday delivered remarks about his administration's efforts to boost the country's supply chains heading into the holiday season. Above, Biden delivers remarks at the start of a hybrid virtual roundtable with CEOs and leaders of retail, consumer products firms and grocery store chains in the Eisenhower Executive Office Building on November 29 in Washington, D.C.
node.description: The president said the CEOs of major retailers recently told him "their inventories are up" and their "shelves are well-stocked" heading into the holidays.
node.content:
["President Joe Biden on Wednesday joked that Santa Claus is the only one who can guarantee that everyone's gifts will arrive on time this holiday season.", "Biden made the remark while addressing the public from the White House about concerns regarding supply chain delays and inflation. Both have become top issues heading into the winter holidays.", "The president acknowledged that reports of empty shelves and low toy supplies have peppered the news media in recent weeks but said that, \"for the vast majority of the country, that's not what's happening\" due to steps his administration has taken to combat supply chain issues.", "Biden detailed some of those steps, including efforts to alleviate port congestion along the West Coast and providing truckers who are transporting \"critical goods\" with flexibility for how much time they can spend behind the wheel. Meetings Biden held earlier this week with the CEOs of some of the largest retail companies in the U.S. revealed that \"their inventories are up, shelves are well-stocked, and they're ready to meet the current demand for the holidays,\" the president said.", "", "
President Joe Biden on Wednesday delivered remarks about his administration's efforts to boost the country's supply chains heading into the holiday season. Above, Biden delivers remarks at the start of a hybrid virtual roundtable with CEOs and leaders of retail, consumer products firms and grocery store chains in the Eisenhower Executive Office Building on November 29 in Washington, D.C.
", "Biden went on to say that the CEO of Etsy told him the small business owners the company represents appear to be less concerned about supply chain problems this year than they were in 2020.", "\"Now, I can't promise that every person will get every gift they want on time. Only Santa Claus can keep that promise,\" Biden joked.", "This is a developing story and will be updated as more information becomes available."]
